context: Sarah led the engineering organization at 167Pluto where Stevan architected the betting platform
name: Sarah Chen
text:
Stevan joined 167Pluto as a Senior Software Engineer, but his contributions went
far beyond that title. He single-handedly architected our event-driven betting
platform from the ground up, making critical decisions about microservices
boundaries, data consistency patterns, and infrastructure that positioned us for
scale.

The technical challenges we faced were significant â€“ building a betting platform
that could handle millions of concurrent users during major sporting events
while maintaining data consistency and sub-100ms latency. Stevan's architecture
using NestJS microservices and Kafka event streaming proved to be exactly what
we needed. During our largest traffic event (World Cup final), the platform
handled 2M+ concurrent users without a single hiccup.

What sets Stevan apart is his balance of pragmatism and technical excellence. He
advocated for best practices like comprehensive testing and CI/CD automation,
but he also knew when to ship and iterate rather than over-engineering. His
CI/CD pipeline reduced our deployment time by 80% and enabled us to ship
multiple times daily with confidence.

Stevan also emerged as a natural technical leader. He mentored three mid-level
engineers who all significantly improved under his guidance. His code reviews
were thorough yet constructive, and he established patterns and standards that
the entire team adopted.

I cannot recommend Stevan highly enough. He's a rare combination of
architectural vision, hands-on execution, and leadership ability. Any company
would be fortunate to have him.
title: CTO
